Age measured at return migration (adult return timing).

Amber status implies caution in the management of the Conservation Unit. While a CU in the Amber zone should be at a low risk of loss, there will be a degree of lost production. Decisions about the conservation of CUs in the Amber zone will involve broader consideration of biological, social, and economic issues.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

A local interbreeding group of organisms within a species. In salmon, a deme typically corresponds to a spawning population at a specific site. Demes are the finest biological unit and make up populations.

The number of mature salmon that pass through (or escape) fisheries and return to fresh water to spawn.

definition: Legal provisions in Canada's Fisheries Act and regulations related to maintaining and rebuilding fish stocks, including obligations triggered when reference points are breached.

Automated counting at a constrained opening using electronic/optical counters, resistivity counters, or video/camera systems. QA review of automated events, cross-section coverage, and uptime/coverage are documented.

definition: Salmon are guided through a controlled opening in a fence/weir where trained observers visually tally each passage event on a continuous or daily schedule. Counting chambers/windows and SIL/SEN daily logs document coverage; bypass routes are monitored and closed where possible.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Seasonal total = roll‑up of daily/continuous counts from a fixed (non‑sonar) station; simple arithmetic with documented coverage.

definition: Salmon age notation where total age is annotated with freshwater years as a subscript-like suffix (for example, 4_2 for total age 4 with 2 freshwater years).

Individuals that were born or reared in a hatchery facility.

definition: Freshwater in-river phase (migration and/or residence) outside the marine environment.

Indicator streams are those that have been identified in some Regions as providing more reliable indices of spawner abundance. Indicator streams tend to give relatively accurate annual spawner abundance estimates, given that they use higher quality methodologies and are more intensively/regularly surveyed. Indicator streams are also assumed to be representative of spawner returns to other streams in close geographic proximity.
definition_source: https://www.salmonexplorer.ca/methods/glossary.html

definition: Interpolation used for missing data; defensibility must be documented
A phase or segment used to stratify salmon measurements by where or when they apply (e.g., ocean phase, terminal phase).
Controlled vocabulary for life-phase or fishery/migration segment qualifiers used to stratify measurements (e.g., ocean, terminal, mainstem).

A fish stock experiencing serious harm may be depleted to the point where it has impaired productivity or reproductive capacity. As a result, the stock would be less resilient to fishing and could not easily rebuild. Serious harm may be irreversible, or only slowly reversible over the long-term, and can be due to fishing, other human-induced impacts, or natural causes. Under the Precautionary Approach policy and the Fish Stocks Provisions (FSPs), breaching the LRP is a trigger for a rebuilding plan.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: WSP long-term trend metric computed from trend-designated wild spawner series to support rapid status determination.

A lower-threshold benchmark value, typically delineating the boundary between Red and Amber status zones.
Lower benchmark value for a metric used to delineate Wild Salmon Policy status zones (typically the boundary between Red and Amber zones).

Controlled vocabulary for policy and governance frameworks referenced by salmon assessment metrics and benchmarks (e.g., WSP, PA).

A group of organisms of the same species occupying a defined area that interbreed and share a gene pool. In salmon, populations are composed of one or more demes and form the biological basis for Conservation Units.
Relates a population to the Conservation Unit it belongs to.
DFO policy framework for applying precaution in fisheries decision-making, including use of reference points and stock status zones.

Probability metric estimating risk of abundance declining below lower benchmark.

A Conservation Unit in the Red zone is undesirable because of the risk of extirpation, and the loss of ecological benefits and salmon production. Changes in status will trigger management actions that will vary depending on species, geographic regions, and cause of the decline.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition_source: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.

definition: An information-defined grouping of fish populations used for reporting, conservation assessment, or management purposes. Examples include Conservation Units (CUs), Stock Management Units (MUs), and Designatable Units (DUs).
Insufficient QA review of automated events
Measurement context indicating values refer to run size or returning run composition.
Run-window coverage < 95% of season days
Origin category describing whether salmon are naturally produced, hatchery produced, or mixed-origin.
Controlled vocabulary for describing the origin of individual salmon (e.g., natural-origin, hatchery-origin, mixed-origin).
Measurement context indicating values refer to spawners or spawning-stage fish.
An operationally-defined grouping of salmon used for assessment and management purposes. A stock is a management unit or reporting stratum, not a biological organism.

definition_source_text: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary; Pacific Salmon Commission Technical Report No. 49.

A field event that collects information about key fish stocks to track their status, and track progress to implement fishery policies and measures for these stocks.

definition: Measurement context indicating values represent survival, mortality, or related rates.

term_name: Target or limit rate or abundance
definition: A value specification representing a policy- or model-defined target or limit, such as TAC or UMSY.
Phase occurring in terminal areas near river mouths or spawning areas (often including terminal fisheries and local migration to spawning sites).
Poor timing of surveys
Age value represents total age in years.
The overall proportion of the total return of adult salmon removed by all fisheries over a defined period, aggregating across gear or fishery components.
Trap-based counts from non-spanning traps with documented emptying schedule, efficiency measurements, and coverage information.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Trap efficiency not measured/validated
Trap-based counts adjusted with efficiency/coverage models to estimate total passage.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Total, seasonal counts through fence or fishway; virtually no bypass. Simple, often single step analysis. Reliable resolution of between year differences >10% (in absolute units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Indirect estimate of total spawner abundance with qualified accuracy and known precision (i.e., a variance estimate—an explicit quantitative measure of uncertainty around the estimate). Derived from high-effort, standardized methods (e.g., mark-recapture, serial counts for area under the curve) with documented analytical conversions (including interpolation/calibration as needed). Reported in absolute units (estimate ± variance). Reliable resolution of between-year differences >25% (in absolute units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Relative abundance index (i.e., not an absolute count) derived from moderate to high effort surveys (typically 3 or more site visits) using standardized methods applied consistently between and within years (e.g., equal-effort surveys executed by walk, swim, overflight). Accuracy and precision are not fully quantified (i.e., no explicit variance estimate), but are assumed stable enough for within-series comparisons. Reliable resolution of between-year differences >25% (in relative units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Low to moderate effort (1-4 trips), known survey method. Simple analysis by known methods. Reliable resolution of between year differences >200% (in relative units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Low effort (e.g. 1 trip), use of vaguely defined, inconsistent or poorly executed methods. Unknown to ill defined; inconsistent or poorly executed. Uncertain numeric comparisons, but high reliability for presence or absence.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Non-numeric, year-specific record of presence/not detected (i.e., present/absent without estimating a count), tied to an explicit time and location, with reliable species identification. Underlying field methods may be highly variable; analysis is not required.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: An upper-threshold benchmark value, typically delineating the boundary between Amber and Green status zones.
Upper benchmark value for a metric used to delineate Wild Salmon Policy status zones (typically the boundary between Amber and Green zones).
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: A threshold below which fishing must be reduced to avoid reaching the LRP. The USR must be set at an appropriate distance above the LRP to provide sufficient opportunity for managers to recognize a declining stock status and sufficient time for management actions to take effect.
definition_source: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.
definition_source_text: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.

definition: Counting/device uptime < 95% (or <90% with interpolation)
Poor visibility conditions
Visual surveys conducted by stream/bank walk with documented visit schedule, reach coverage, timing, and visibility conditions.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Two or more trained snorkelers conduct standardized passes within defined segments, tallying live/dead by species. Field forms capture visibility class, segment boundaries, and repeat-visit schedule; counts are aggregated across observers/passes.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Canada's Wild Salmon Policy framework for conserving and managing wild Pacific salmon, including integrated status assessments and biological benchmarks for Conservation Units.

term_name: Wild Salmon Policy biological status zone
definition: The biological status of a Conservation Unit (CU) will normally be based on the abundance and distribution of spawners in the unit, or proxies thereof. For each CU, higher and lower benchmarks will be defined that will delimit three status zones: Green, Amber, and Red. As spawner abundance decreases, a CU moves towards the lower status zone, and the extent of management intervention for conservation purposes will increase.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: Controlled vocabulary for biological status zones under the Wild Salmon Policy.

The WSP rapid status assessment approach builds on previously completed WSP integrated status assessments. The WSP rapid status approach ensures statuses are scientifically objective, consistent, and comparable across BC/Yukon CUs. This approach is also relatively easy to implement, applicable to data rich and data poor CUs, and can be updated annually.
definition_source: Pestal, G., MacDonald, B. L., Grant, S. C. H., and Holt, C. A. (2023). State of the Salmon: rapid status assessment approach for Pacific salmon under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy. Can. Tech. Rep. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 3570: xiv + 200 p.
definition_source_text: Pestal, G., MacDonald, B. L., Grant, S. C. H., and Holt, C. A. (2023). State of the Salmon: rapid status assessment approach for Pacific salmon under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy. Can. Tech. Rep. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 3570: xiv + 200 p.

definition: Threshold value used by the rapid-status algorithm that may differ from expert-defined benchmarks to incorporate precautionary buffers.
definition_source: DFO (2024). Rapid Status Approximations for Pacific Salmon Derived from Integrated Expert Assessments under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy. CSAS Science Response 2024/004.
definition_source_text: DFO (2024). Rapid Status Approximations for Pacific Salmon Derived from Integrated Expert Assessments under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy. CSAS Science Response 2024/004.

definition: A year-based temporal reference used to contextualize measurements or rates (e.g., brood year or catch year).
